content:
If this is the wrong place for this discussion please let me know.

I want to give Zulip a try and would want to host it on a box that already has Python, nginx, rabbitmq and postgres installed. Can I safely just use the installer https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/stable/production/install.html (will it reuse the already installed elements and prompt for any authentication needed) or should I treat it like the services are across different machines and use the deployment process (https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/stable/production/deployment.html)?
@Justin Phillips you can use the installer, but you should be aware that Zulip expects to control the configuration of those services.

@Tim Abbott So will it actually configure/change the existing PSQL and rMQ server/service settings? If so I'll probably want to use the deployment method as I would want it to be consumer of the services and not the manager of them.
@Justin Phillips yep, if that's what you want, you'll want to follow the deployment.html docs.
@Tim Abbott Cool. thank you for the guidance.
